summary: This document is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff regarding draft press remarks related to the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. The email includes an attachment with edits to the remarks and discusses keeping the language conservative and closely tied to the indictment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of indictment and press remarks
persons.context: The email exchange is about drafting press remarks related to her indictment. She is the central subject of the document.

persons.name: Audrey
persons.role: Presumed U.S. Attorney's Office staff member
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who will likely be conservative regarding the content of the press remarks, suggesting she is involved in the legal or public affairs strategy.

connections.description: Audrey is part of the legal team (U.S. Attorney's Office) preparing press remarks regarding Maxwell's indictment.

events.title: Drafting of Ghislaine Maxwell Press Remarks
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff exchange emails and a draft document containing press remarks related to the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) dated June 26, 2020.
The subject is drafting press remarks related to the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email indicates a strategy to keep the press remarks conservative and closely tied to the language of the indictment draft.
An attachment named 'Ghislaine_Maxwell_Press_Remarks.docx' is referenced, containing edited remarks.
